Posts.Content: ameliak wrote: Hi all, I've never posted on here before, but I just got some bad news yesterday and would love to get feedback from women going through something similar. I have stage IV bc with bone and liver mets and I'm er positive. When I was diagnosed in England Aug. 2010 (my husband is military), I got chemo (FEC) which shrunk the tumors. My family and I moved back to the States and my doctor tried all the hormone therapie - none worked. I began gemzar and carboplatin in Sept. 2011, which shrunk some of the tumors. However, I just had a scan Mon. and found out the 2 biggest liver tumors  grew. My doctor is world -renowned and I trust him, but the only option he says is left is a phase one trial of a drug that I would have to get with chemo 2x/week. He says I'd be able to function well but I would lose all of my new curls, which I didn't handle well at all the first time. There's no guarantee this drug would work, of course, or that it would extend my life more than a few more months. I don't want to just be alive; I want to really live. I have 3 weeks to decide, as the trial starts then, but I'm leaning heavily toward stopping treatment and just letting my body (and my liver) do its thing. I have no idea how long it would take for my liver to shut down and what would happen...does anyone have any experience about this. Thanks for reading this far :) Amy Log in to post a reply
